title: What causes an economic recession? - Richard Coffin

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of a recession?

options.label: A
options.text: A mismatch between the number of goods people want to buy and the number of products and services producers can offer.

options.label: B
options.text: A decrease in the value of money.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of low interest rates on companies?

options.label: A
options.text: It increases the cost of borrowing money.

options.label: B
options.text: It decreases the cost of borrowing money.

options.label: C
options.text: It has no effect on the cost of borrowing money.

options.label: D
options.text: It increases the cost of production.

multiple-choice.question: What can cause a recession even in times of economic prosperity?

options.label: C
options.text: Business activity reaching an unsustainable level.

multiple-choice.question: How can fear of a recession contribute to its occurrence?

options.label: A
options.text: It can cause people to invest more.

options.label: B
options.text: It can cause people to spend more.

options.label: C
options.text: It can cause people to pull back investing and spending.

options.label: D
options.text: It can cause producers to increase operating costs.

multiple-choice.question: What can be a consequence of policies designed to help prevent recessions?
